text: John Scott (1912–1976) was an American writer. He was in the Soviet Union from 1932 to 1941. His best-known book, Behind the Urals: An American Worker in Russia's City of Steel, is a memoir of that. Most of his career was as a journalist, book author, and editor with Time Life. ==References== ==Sources== * * * *Sam Tanenhaus, Whittaker Chambers, New York: Random House (1997), pg. 182. *John Earl Haynes and Harvey Klehr, Venona: Decoding Soviet Espionage in America, New Haven: Yale University Press, (1999), pgs. 194, 195, 237. ==Further reading== * Tim Tzouliadis.
